GP Sales Representative - Adelaide North

Company Name Sanofi Company Location Adelaide, AU

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 1 view

Job description

GP Sales Representative - Diabetes [Adelaide North]
  • World leading biopharmaceutical organisation
  • A great team and company culture
  • An organisation positioned to grow your career
More than just a job

When you join an organisation, the question many ask is what will life be like? The question we ask you is, what difference will you make? No matter your role within Sanofi Australia and New Zealand, you are able to make a difference. Sanofi, Empowering Life

Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

About The Role

Due to an internal transfer within Sanofi, we are currently looking for a GP Sales Representative - Diabetes to join our successful SA Sales Team to help promote our leading diabetes products. In this challenging and rewarding role, your key responsibilities include working within a dedicated sales team, managing your territory sales and product portfolio. Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager SA/WA/NT, your objective is to gain acceptance of our products by key Doctors to achieve desired patient outcomes. You will utilise your excellent targeting and profiling abilities to build strong business oriented relationships with your customers. The exciting and high performing territory that you will manage comprises Adelaide Northern metropolitan and Northern Regional areas.

Here is a little around the selection criteria
  • You will need to have a proven track record in sales
  • GP Sales exp will be highly regarded
  • Strong B2B sales
  • Self-assured and persuasive
  • Quick thinking and an ethical professional who excels working in a targeted environment
  • You are ideally tertiary qualified in a Science or Business discipline
  • Excellent networking skills and strategic focus to drive these core Sanofi brands
As a leading global healthcare company Sanofi considers all candidates equally. We believe in the value of diversity and inclusion and work hard to create workplaces where every person’s voice is heard. You will receive a competitive salary plus tool of trade vehicle/allowance, learning and development opportunities, career opportunities all while working in a positive, supportive and fun work environment. A full clean driver’s license is essential.

Interested? Then please apply online today and don’t miss out on this opportunity!

Please note

To apply for this role you must already have the right to lawfully work and live in Australia.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Entry level

Senior JavaScript Software Engineer

Company Name Rezdy Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 49 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Growing International travel tech company based in Sydney
  • Join a dynamic team passionate about creating the best product for our Customers
  • Winner of Best Ease of Use Award by Capterra 2018

You may not have heard of Rezdy, but if you have ever booked a tour or activity online you have most likely experienced our platform. Rezdy is the fastest growing global technology provider for Tours & Activities operators. We empower our customers to network, trade and thrive through our world-class B2B cloud booking platform and distribution marketplace. Our customers include zoo’s, whale watching tours, charters, shuttles and many more.
\xa0
Rezdy emerged when our founder led a dive centre in Thailand. Simon became frustrated that more time was spent behind the desk handling bookings than sharing his love of diving, adventure sports and marine life with customers. With a previous background in IT, Simon identified there was a gap in the market and in 2011 Rezdy opened for business.
\xa0
Today, thousands of operators and agents in over 100 countries trust the Rezdy platform. As a growing independent operator in our marketplace we are proud to serve all of our customers equally.
\xa0
As a Senior Software Engineer you will play a leading role in delivering high quality, well engineered software solutions for our customers. Your core programming language is JavaScript, but you also have strong HTML / CSS skills, perhaps with a splash of PHP or Java, and experience building responsive mobile web applications.

What you will do:

  • Your responsibilities include designing, building and delivering sophisticated solutions and product features for a popular, highly available SaaS platform.
  • You love learning new skills and are comfortable collaborating and sharing with the rest of the team through technical design sessions, lightning talks, brown bag lunches and workshops
  • You will write and maintain clean, well-organised, well-designed modern JavaScript and HTML / CSS
  • You will design, build and implement new product features according to product roadmap and product requirements
  • You will build efficient, testable, reusable and modular code using engineering best practices and standard methodologies
  • You will develop and deploy new features to facilitate related procedures and tools if necessary
  • You will lead improvements in the software development process and oversee efforts with the rest of the team
  • You will collaborate on development estimates and sprint planning sessions
  • You will contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle when developing the Product Roadmap
  • You will translate UI/UX wireframes to visual elements with ease
  • You will solve problems, test and maintain the core product software, integrations and related services to ensure strong optimisation and functionality

Who you are:
  • You have strong commercial experience with a modern JavaScript framework such as Vue, React or Angular and experience in building an application from the ground up
  • You think agile (scrum and kanban) - you are naturally curious and love to solve problems
  • You have a real passion for development with a focus on quality
  • You have excellent written and interpersonal skills with experience engaging with a variety of partners and others within the business
  • You have hands on experience in architecture, building, debugging and supporting highly available applications including responsive mobile applications (web and/or native)
  • You have a solid grasp of good software design principles including OOP, SOLID, DRY, unit testing, performance testing, version control and security
  • You have strong experience in standard front-end technologies such as modern HTML, CSS, Less / SASS and JavaScript
  • You have good knowledge of cloud-based infrastructure such as AWS and related services ( e.g. EC2, S3, ECS, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, etc)
  • You have confidence with Agile software development, ideally including CD / CI practices
  • You may have experience with Docker, Webpack, Gulp and / or Grunt

We’re looking for someone who loves learning new skills and equally sharing knowledge and collaborating with our team. You’re a great teammate who’s passionate about building the best possible product for our customers.
\xa0
Rezdy champions different ways of thinking. We are committed to establishing a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
\xa0
Come join us, apply now.

SafetyCulture is a global disruptive software business making the digitalisation of checklists increasingly sophisticated. Its both hard and ambitious.


The Role


To take our customers from zero to hero to ensure that as a global team we successfully onboard 25,000 NEW organisations this year! As part of our Sydney based Success team you'll be the first point of contact for high potential customers in the APAC region, working with them to ensure a best in class implementation of iAuditor throughout their organisation.

Are you game?


The Soul

You give a sh#t. You live and breathe customer solutions and you never (ever) give up until the problem is solved. You are a product advocate who is passionate about putting safety and quality in the hands of every worker.


You’re not a passenger! You want to change the world. We are aiming for 1 million workers improving safety and quality by 2020.

  • We know a thing or two about making our employees happy, and we go the extra mile connecting our people to our mission.


Location:


Sydney is for you if you enjoy the hustle and bustle. It has a great quality of life with a hive of activity including world famous landmarks, great restaurants and iconic beaches. Our Sydney office is in an area with great facilities and easy access via transport.

You will be supporting at risk young people and their families to address issues of homelessness and family breakdown. Must be able to demonstrate an understanding of the needs/issues of young people at risk of being homeless, disengaged from education and community.


Key responsibilities (not limited to):


  • Collates and maintains clear up to date organised and accurate records and case notes
  • Keeps informed of theoretical and practice issues that ensure best practice is developed and maintained

About The Company

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

genU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.

About The Role

An exciting opportunity exists for a Case Manager to support clients with multiple or complex needs who reside in the community. We work from a strong client directed approach ensuring that we collaboratively develop goals to best meet client needs. We work with people who are aging, those with a disability and people experiencing the significant impact of health conditions

Duties

Responsibilities Will Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Complete and develop a comprehensive care plan in partnership with consumers which identifies their goal directed outcomes
  • Work with individuals, their families and supports to ensure that any care plan developed has been consumer directed and meets their needs and objectives
  • Conduct regular reviews of care plans and ongoing monitoring and review of approaches and strategies used in the delivery of care in response to the changing needs of care recipients
  • Identification of and engagement with a range of service partners


Skills And Experience

The role requires a skilled and energetic team player who is flexible and committed. You will have excellent assessment and communication skills.

The ideal candidate will possess appropriate tertiary qualification and/or extensive experience in a human service discipline. As well as demonstrated experience in community care (particularly care/case management)

Must have an understanding of the social, psychological and physical aspects of ageing and disability including the role of carers and a commitment to the principles and practice of consumer directed services

  • Full Time Position
  • Healesville Location, Victoria - 12 month Fixed Term
  • Salary packaging available

About The Role

MARP is looking for an experienced Alcohol and Drug Counsellor/Group Facilitators to provide treatment and support for alcohol and other drugs clients.
  • Position will be 5 nights per week ( and will include some weekends)
  • Must have AOD qualifications & experience in a sleepover role.
  • Must be able to drive 11 seater commuter bus
  • Sole worker shift

About You

The successful candidate will support positive behavioural change through delivery of evidence based therapeutic interventions and by working collaboratively with clients and their families. If you are passionate about working with a newly formed team with a new vision, this position may be for you.

About EACH

A contemporary not-for-profit EACH provides a range of health disability, counselling and mental health services to the community. From humble beginnings established in the Outer East of Melbourne over 44 years ago, committed teams at EACH now consist of over 1300 staff across 65 sites throughout the eastern states of Australia. Together we support over 40 000 clients annually.

At EACH, our vision is for a healthy and inclusive community. Our values promote Customer Centricity, Social Justice, Service Excellence, Innovation and Collaboration - and these underpin the way we work and deliver our services.

You can find out more about us here - http://www.each.com.au

You’ll use your excellent communication skills to build rapport and communicate complex information.


It’s an exciting environment and on a typical day you might find yourself:


  • Making decisions on requests for treatment, rehabilitation and care services to ensure the needs of people with severe injuries are met, empowering them to participate in their community
  • Provide advice on injury management and service delivery
  • Collaborate with internal teams
  • Work within the legislative framework and promote respect for participants
  • Participate in internal quality assurance and improvement

We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.


If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 5 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.


We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach, so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.


If there are any accessibility adjustments you need to help you be able to apply for this role, or if you require any further information about the role, please contact Kerry Goode on (02) 9216 3060 for a chat.


For temp roles - Please note that you must be an Australian citizen, a permanent resident of Australia, a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport or a citizen of another country with a current visa that allows you to work in Australia for the duration of this temporary role.\xa0


  • icare is the brand of Insurance & Care NSW
  • For more information about icare visit our website
  • icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted

    The position is responsible for field repairs, responding to emergency calls and scheduling preventive maintenance visits to meet service agreement obligations while focusing on quality service and customer satisfaction for the Acute Care Therapy and Surgical Workplace division. Salesforce Administrator

Company Name SiteMinder Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

SiteMinder is the #1 cloud provider for hotel integrations and bookings. We are an energetic, fast-moving tech company that has managed to retain our start up heart and sense of humour while taking over our industry as the partners of choice for over 30,000 hoteliers worldwide. Backed by the same investors at Facebook, Netflix and Spotify, we’re an Australian software company with market leading products that support hotels to manage and maximise their online presence. Headquartered in the Rocks in Sydney, we also have offices in Bangkok, London, Dallas, and Galway.

Think you're up for the challenge?

We're looking for an experienced Salesforce Administrator who will partner with the business to provide support and work closely with our in-house Salesforce team to continually improve the Salesforce environment.

We are working on some super exciting and challenging projects that impacts our global teams and has touch points across multiple areas of the business. As our Salesforce Administrator you will be directly involved in these projects specifically Service Cloud and Community Cloud builds and implementation.

In This Role You Will
  • Manage support queue and close tickets within the designated SLA
  • Work closely with the Salesforce Developers, Salesforce Analyst and Architect to continually improve the Salesforce environment
  • Creation of custom objects, workflows, email alerts and templates
  • Involved with Service Cloud and/or Community Cloud builds and implementation
  • Develop and maintain end-user process guides/manuals
  • Daily administration and support of SiteMinders’ Salesforce database, including managing user setups, creating rules, user support, customisation of objects, fields, record types, page layouts and validations
  • Work with management and end users to create and manage complex workflow rules and validations
  • Liaise with Salesforce Premier + Support where necessary, logging problems and tracking to resolution
What does success in this role look like? A successful Salesforce Administrator at SiteMinder is:
  • Amazing with managing their time and has solid Salesforce Administration knowledge
  • Able to independently perform configurations, testing, implementation, documentation and updating on the Salesforce platform
  • Experienced in creating / maintaining Community Cloud deployments
  • Knowledgeable in the latest Salesforce technologies
  • Experienced and knowledgeable in creating Salesforce rules and complex reports
In return for your skills and talent, you will be joining a global tech company of approx. 600 staff globally who are on the cusp of an aggressive diversification and growth phase. We have some pretty cool perks, we operate at pace, we have fun while we’re doing it – we celebrate our successes and we’re creating something pretty special.

If you want challenges, ownership, accountability and a place where growth both personally and organisationally are inevitable click apply!

We're well aware that this is quite a wish-list of skills therefore if you believe you have a great blend of at least some of the above we’d love to hear from you

Job description

Deli Team Manager

You inspire team members, develop fresh talent and lead by example to deliver the very best shopping experience in your department.
Woolworths, a job is never just a job.

It’s the start of something bigger. There are over 128,000 of us, in the biggest cities and the tiniest towns. And each of us have an important role to play. If you have a passion for great customer service, a hunger to make a tangible difference and you’re looking for a place to develop, you could be who we’re looking for.
Who we are

Joining Woolworths Supermarkets means being a part of the the wider Woolworths Group, which includes the businesses of BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, Cellarmasters, ALH Group and Countdown (NZ). Which means you won’t have one opportunity with us, you’ll have thousands.
Why work with us
Whether you’re starting out, already on the way to achieving your goals or at the top of your game, we can help you build a brilliant retail career- If you’ve got goals, we’ve got all you need to succeed. You’ll find over a thousand career options, plus the learning encouragement and support for you to grow. We’re a team that is there for each other. By working alongside people you can learn from, you’ll grow and develop in a fun, supportive environment. Working with a diverse range of people in an industry facing rapid change, you’ll gain real-world experience and grow as a person. Whether it’s making customers smile, supporting Aussie farmers, or playing an important role in your local community, you’ll be doing a little good every day at Woolworths.
When you will be needed

Meeting the needs of our customers is our number one priority and right now we need a full time salaried team member who can work flexible retail hours which includes mornings, days, late evenings and weekends.
What makes you right for Woolies

The right attitude is everything....
  • Genuine passion for food & shopping
  • Customer first mentality
  • Love of teamwork and growing with others
  • Flexible and adaptable to change
  • Willing to work and reliable

Senior Academic Governance Officer

Company Name Study Group Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Study Group is one of the world’s largest international education and training organisations. Every year over 70,000 students from more than 130 countries choose to study with Study Group. We invest in international students’ futures and enhance their prospects by focusing on the way they learn as well as the qualifications they achieve. In Australia, we deliver a wide range of pathway, higher education, vocational and English language programs for students from all over the world.

\xa0

We are currently seeking two staff experienced in Academic Governance Support to provide professional secretariat and project coordination services to the governing boards and committees of the University Partnerships and Higher Education Operations of Study Group ANZ, and the Head of Academic Quality Assurance and Governance.

Senior Academic Governance Officer

Role Type: Ongoing, full time role, based in Sydney.

Salary Range: Approx. $85,000 per annum (+ superannuation)


The position is responsible for

  • Managing and conducting a comprehensive secretariat service that effectively supports a large case load of Board/Committee meetings, including preparation of meeting agenda, thorough minute taking, and assisting with the implementation of meeting resolutions.
  • Accurately maintaining Governance and Committee information including registers, policies, procedures and associated documents including those required under legislation.
  • Contributing to the successful operation of the Academic Quality Assurance and Governance Office through the application of professional senior project coordination skills; student performance, survey and quality indicators data collation and reporting skills; administrative support skills; and stakeholder liaison/communication skills.

\xa0

Experience, Skills and Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2-years of relevant secretariat servicing experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in providing Board and/or committee secretariat services in a tertiary education or equivalent public/private sector setting, including minute taking.
  • Experience in maintaining governance and committee information including registers, policies, procedures and associated documents including those required under legislation.
  • Experience in the preparation of business reports and other written documentation
  • High level verbal and written communication skills.
  • Advanced skills with software packages, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet, email, calendar and electronic document management systems.
  • Ability to coordinate and undertake research and prepare correspondence, statistical and qualitative reports, and other written documentation.
  • Ability to apply a high level of confidentiality and sensitivity to a range of business matters.
  • Advanced organisation and self-management skills including the ability to effectively prioritise duties to meet deadlines, with professionalism and maintain consistent high standards.
  • Ability to work effectively individually and as a member of a geographically dispersed team.
  • Ability to negotiate and resolve conflict constructively, work in a tactful and diplomatic manner and respond appropriately when dealing with sensitive matters.
  • General understanding of the role and function of governance and committee processes in a highly regulated organisational context.
  • Knowledge of legislation relevant to High School, Foundation, ELICOS, Higher Education and/or CRICOS education providers.


To apply, please email your application to Jill Woodruff, Head of Academic Quality Assurance and Governance, SGA JWoodruff@studygroup.com

Job description

Who are we?\xa0


CoreLogic is a wholly owned subsidiary of CoreLogic (NYSE: CLGX), and is the largest data and analytics company in the world. CoreLogic provides property information, analytics and services across Australia and New Zealand and is currently developing and growing partnerships throughout Asia. With Australia's most comprehensive property databases, the company's combined data offering is derived from public, contributory and proprietary sources and includes over 500 million decision points spanning over three decades of collection, providing detailed coverage of property and other encumbrances such as tenancy, location, hazard risk and related performance information.

With over 11,000 customers and 120,000 end users, CoreLogic is the leading provider of property data, analytics and related services to consumers, investors, real estate, mortgage, finance, banking, insurance, developers, wealth management and government.


This role is responsible for Australia, New Zealand and a small office in the UK.


    Key Responsibilities:

    \xa0

    • Ownership of risk register for Australia, NZ and UK – regular risk reporting, management and mitigation testing
    • Compliance responsibilities, with particular focus on managing CoreLogic’s privacy compliance obligations under the Privacy Acts across Australia and NZ, various state obligations in Australia and an oversight of UK compliance activity.
    • Data Governance Committee, ISO certification and compliance, SOX audits, working with internal audit in the US, exit and onboarding processes
    • Compliance awareness internally including preparing annual compliance training (developing appropriate local training in conjunction with US compliance team), phishing awareness campaigns, information security week
    • Managing BCP

    \xa0

    Key Competencies Required:

    • Strong communication skills, both written and oral
    • Ability to engage and communicate constructively and confidently with a range of internal stakeholders
    • Proactive – able to drive matters through and escalate appropriately where needed
    • Ability to absorb and manage detailed information while keeping big picture strategic concepts in focus also

    \xa0

    \xa0What do you need to a have?

    • Relevant university qualification
    • Corporate experience in risk management
    • Corporate experience in compliance
    • Familiarity with cyber security risks (sufficient to understand and provide checks/balances on technology function)


Ready to be more at CoreLogic?\xa0Please include your Cover Letter and Resume when applying
